alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 10:39AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands, pasture and farmland adjacent to river throughout Mason Valley-Yerington area. Several rural and some secondary public roads flood. Yards and basements of lowest homes adjacent to the river in Mason and Yerington begin flooding. Preventative sandbagging is necessary. Possible damage to irrigation structures and levees Similar to June 24, 2017 peak, and slightly higher than July 1, 2011 peak. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:05 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:05 AM PDT Sunday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near moderate flood stage of 11.0 feet through Wednesday then fall slightly to 10.7 feet by Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - https://www.cnrfc.noaa.gov http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Mason Bridge and Miller Lane are closed. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday by 4:00 PM PDT.
